INTRV = Intervention, a contingency arising from a
decision to commit in a foreign nation, with or without
INSG = Insurgency, a contingency arising from revolt
against a recognized or extablished government through
the use of subversion and armed conflict that does not
reach the proportions of civil war.
ASSIST = Military Assistance, a contingency arising from
the deployment of troops, usually small in number, to
train, develop, or in other ways aid in a non-combatant
role the military forces of another nation.
PKPG = Peacekeeping, a contingency arising from the
deployment of troops in a trouble spot, usually as part
of a multi-national force under the auspices of a
multi-national organization, with missions such as
acting as a buffer between opposing forces, monitoring
or enforcing treaty or cease-fire provisions, or in
other ways helping to prevent the outbreak or spread of
from the deployment of troops to help extract
noncombatants from situations ranging from potentially
dangerous to overtly hostile in nature.
POLACT = Police Action, a contingency arising from the
deployment of troops in support of established civil
law  enforcement personnel to aid in their operations
and  provide military expertise and assistance in the
RAID = Raid, a contingency arising from the deployment
of troops in an operation,  usually small in scale,
involving a swift penetration of hostile territory to
secure information, confuse the enemy, or destroy his
CONV = Conventional, a nonnuclear contingency arising
from the deployment of troops as part of a larger
conflict involving traditionally organized and equipped
forces on  both sides engaged in overt hostilities.
O_ = Overland, the attacking force arrived in the battle
area by foot, road, rail, or other overland means.
P_ = Parchute, the attacking force arrived in the battle
area by parachute, jumping from any type of aircraft.
H_ = Helicopter, the attacking force arrived in the
battle area by helicopter, without parachuting.
L_ = Air landing, the attacking force arrived in the
battle area by fixed-wing aircraft, disembarking on the
A_ = Amphibious, the attacking force arrived in the
battle area by disembarking off-shore and reaching land
either by small craft, swimming, or wading.
S_ = Ship landing, the attacking force arrived
in the battle area bby disembarking at a port
_O = Opposed, the attacking force's arrival in the
battle area was contested by the defending force.
_U = Unopposed, the attacking force's arrival in the
battle area was not contested by the defending force.
MIX =Mixed, a force composed of four or more different unit types.
N = Neither side had air superiority, or air superiority was not a fact,or
N = Surprise was not achieved or was not a factor

column2: Surpriser Side (the side that inflicted surprise on its opponent):

column3: ALN = Armee de Liberation Natinale (Algerian National Liberation Army)
ANC = Armee Nationale Congolaise (Congolese National Army)
CMIA = Captured or missing in action
Code No. = Code number assigned by the originators of the data base
EAM/DAG = Greek National Liberation Movement/Democratic Army of Greece
EMA = Etat Major et Appui (Headquarters and Support, used to describe Belgian units)
EOKA = Ethniki Organosis Kyprion Agoniston (Cypriot guerrillas)
FLOST = Front for the Liberation of South Yemen
Gen Res Bde = General Reserve Brigade
OECS = Organization of Eastern Caribbean States
OLOS = Organization for the Liberation of the Occupied South
ONUC = United Nations Operations in the Congo
PFLOAG = Popular Front for the Liberation of the Occupied Arabian Gulf
PFLP = Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine
REP = Regiment Etrangere Parachutiste (Foreign Legion Parachute Regiment)
RIAOM = Regiment interarmes d'outre-mer (Interservice Overseas Regiment)
RPC = Regiment de Parachutistes Coloniaux (Colonial Parachute Regiment)
RPIMa = Regiment de Parachutistes d'Infanteri Marine (Marine Parachute Regiment)
SAA = South Arabian Army (formerly Federal Regular Army)
UNIFIL = United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon
UNIPOM = United Nations India-Pakistan Observer Mission
UNOGIL = United Nations Observer Group in Lebanon
(-) = Elements, part, or a portion of a unit
